OpenID CX v1 documentation

Contract Exchange

«  Privacy Data and Contract   ::   Contents   ::   Providing Request File  »

Contract Exchange¶

Protocol¶

Contract Exchange(CX) is a protocol to create Contract, to share privacy data and to provide access log.

  • Creating Contact
    • Proposal process & Agreement process
    • Contract provisioning with encrypted JSON
  • Sharing privacy data
    • Encrypted JSON
  • Access log
    • Negotiating metadata
    • Encypted JSON

Components¶

CX consists of the following components.

  • OpenID Artifact Binding
  • JSON
  • X.509 and PKI
  • JSON Simple Sign
  • JSON Simple Encryption
  • Token
  • Token is a serialization format in the process of JSON SImple Sign.

Process¶

  • Service Advertisement
    • Client provides Request.
    • Proposer collects all necessary Request from all Client.
    • Proposer advertise his service.
  • Proposal
    • End User starts CX procedure for the service provied by Proposer.
  • Agreement
    • End User agrees the Proposal and Signatory creates a Contract.
  • Contract Provisioning
  • Proposer gets his Contract Part.
  • Proposer is notified his Contract Part available.
  • Client is notified his Contract Part available.
  • Server realizes that his Contract Part available.
  • Privacy Data Sharing
  • Client request End User s privacy data at Server.
  • Log Gathering
  • Signatory collects all access log from all Client and Server.

Party¶

Client¶

  • Client describe what privacy data he want to provide some services in Request token .
  • Client request privacy data to Server.

Server¶

  • Server response encrypted privacy data to Client.
